lines.text: How'd the bricks work out, Stymie?
Well, it took my feet all night long to get those bricks warm, and now it's time to get up.
You kids go out there and milk that cow, and if you spill one drop of it, I'll thrash you!
Uh huh, can you use the word "Isthmus" in a sentence?
Uh huh. "Isthmus be my lucky day!"
[at one end of the telephone line]
Hello? Who is this speaking?
[at the other end]

[looks into mouthpiece]
I don't know, I can't see ya!
Listen, this is Mr. Brown from the First National Bank! Who is this?
Mr. Brown from the First National Bank. That's what you just told me!
Don't drink the milk!
Why not?
It's *spoiled*!
Spoiled nothing! You kids put that milk on your mush and eat it! Eeehh!
Mary had a little lamb, whose fleece was white as snow. If he hollers let him go, eenie, meenie, miney, moe.
He followed her to school one day, and went against the rules. If he hollers let him go, eenie, meenie, miney, moe.
What number is this?
How many guesses?
Listen, I want to speak to Old Cap!
Well why didn't you say so in the first place?!
